page.title: 02GEOLOGY AND ECOLOGY
page.content: The soil is mainly brickearth: about half being Deep Hook Series and one third Shallow Park Gate Series. Both are classed as Grade 1 or 2 for agricultural purposes. The rest is Riverine Alluvium over flinty gravel, it is ill-drained and often marshy. In the NW corner are lakes, the legacy of the sand/gravel extracting industry. Although gravel is no longer extracted one pit still serves as a storage and distribution point for sand brought in by train from the Lavant area. The water-table is high and small streams flow from the marshy areas. The water in the streams is clear and supports abundant life. The stream flowing down Brookside in Runcton is a home for brown trout and frogs - indicating unpolluted water.
